title: Solar Absorber Design: Deep Learning-Based Optimization Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in optics, thermodynamics, and nanostructured materials
context.additional_context: Microlearning course in a BYOD environment where learners experience experimental design using real-case simulation tools, followed by weekly module-based learning and weekend project workshops.

learning_goals: Acquire the ability to design multilayer nanostructures with emissivity characteristics exceeding 90% in the solar spectrum (0.3–2.5 μm) and below 20% in the infrared region (8–13 μm).
Explain the procedure for simulating absorber thickness/materials using a multi-objective optimization algorithm (dual annealing).
Calculate the energy efficiency (annual kWh/m²) of the designed absorber and propose feasible application areas (e.g., arid/high-temperature regions).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
